message.content:
Verb tenses refer to different forms of verbs that indicate the time at which an action occurs or took place in relation to the moment of speaking. There are several common verb tenses:

1. Present Tense: Used for actions happening now, scheduled actions, or general truths. Example: "I eat breakfast every day."

2. Past Tense: Used for completed actions in the past. Example: "Yesterday, I went to the park."

3. Future Tense: Used for planned or predicted actions in the future. Example: "Tomorrow, I will go to the movies."

4. Present Continuous Tense (Progressive): Indicates an action that is happening right now and may continue for some time. Example: "I am watching a movie."

5. Past Continuous Tense (Progressive): Shows an ongoing action from the past. Example: "When I was young, I used to play basketball every day."

6. Future Continuous Tense (Progressive): Describes an action planned or scheduled for the future and will be in progress at that time. Example: "Next week, I will be studying for my exams."

7. Present Perfect Tense: Used to indicate an action with an unspecified time in the past that has some relevance to the present. Example: "I have lived in this city for two years."

8. Past Perfect Tense: Shows an action completed before another action in the past. Example: "When I arrived at the airport, I had been waiting for two hours."

9. Future Perfect Tense: Used to describe an action that will be completed by a point in the future. Example: "By next year, I will have finished my degree."

10. Present Perfect Continuous Tense (Progressive): Indicates an ongoing action that started at some unspecified time in the past and continues up to the present. Example: "I have been working on this project for months."

11. Past Perfect Continuous Tense (Progressive): Shows a continuous action in the past that continued up until another point in the past. Example: "By the time we left, I had been studying for three hours."

12. Future Perfect Continuous Tense (Progressive): Describes an ongoing action that will continue up to a specific point in the future. Example: "By next month, I will have been working at this company for one year."
